poem:
Title: "Oration of Valley Forge Offspring"

In the fields of Valley Forge we multiply,
Simone and I, seeding the world.
Poster children for procreation, we deny
the silence of empty cradles.
Plenty in us, a carnival of life,
blowing kisses to the future.
Too soon, a world of falling leaves - 
but today, we're making plans,
casting apples into barren gardens.
